title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
creator_credit: I.D.D.H., Murakami Wolf Swenson, Fred Wolf Films, Mirage Studios, Surge Licensing, Playmates Toys, Kara Vallow and Andy Luckey
brief_description: Distinctly different from the grim, violent, and dark MIRAGE comics from which the Turtles originated, this version of the franchise has remained the longest-running, and most memorable, version of all.

constellations_other.name: News on location
constellations_other.description: The Pye Orthicon is an example of the type of television cameras used from the 1950s in Australia for both studio and outside broadcast work. Such cameras did not have have the capacity to record while out on location and so outside crews would transmit vision and sound back to studios for recording or live broadcast.

creator_credit_for_label: I.D.D.H., Murakami Wolf Swenson, Fred Wolf Films, Mirage Studios, Surge Licensing, Playmates Toys, Kara Vallow and Andy Luckey
description: Distinctly different from the grim, violent, and dark MIRAGE comics from which the Turtles originated, this version of the franchise has remained the longest running, and most memorable, version of all. Four turtles fall into the sewers and are befriended by Hamato Yoshi a Japanese man sent to New York who was forced to live in the sewers. One day he sees a strange green glow which transforms the four turtles into human-like creatures. Hamato (now Master Splinter) changes into a giant rat from the green glow and teaches the turtles the skills of the ninja as they team up with Channel 6 news reporter April O’Neil to battle against Yoshi’s arch enemy Shredder and Krang, an alien warlord from Dimension X.
description_for_label: Distinctly different from the grim, violent, and dark MIRAGE comics from which the Turtles originated, this version of the franchise has remained the longest running, and most memorable, version of all. One day he sees a strange green glow which transforms the four turtles into human-like creatures. Hamato (now Master Splinter) changes into a giant rat from the green glow and teaches the turtles the skills of the ninja as they team up with Channel 6 news reporter April O’Neil to battle against Yoshi’s arch enemy Shredder and Krang, an alien warlord from Dimension X.
